bug.author: tmattio
bug.description:
Following the documentation to install Kubeflow on AWS here: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
I have an error when running <denchmark-code>${KUBEFLOW_SRC}/scripts/kfctl.sh generate k8s </denchmark-code>
It yields: <denchmark-code>+ sed -i.bak '/^KUBEFLOW_COMPONENTS/ s/$/,\\"aws-alb-ingress-controller\\",\\"istio-ingress\\"/' /tmp/kubeflow-aws/kubeflow/env.sh sed: /tmp/kubeflow-aws/kubeflow/env.sh: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.81. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tmattio>@tmattio</denchmark-link>
Can you help list files under ${KUBEFLOW_REPO}? <denchmark-code>tree -L 3 ${KUBEFLOW_REPO} </denchmark-code>
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
